Function DB-SET-ENCRYPTION

Syntax:

db-set-encryption handle password &key cipher flags => boolean

Arguments and Values:

handle---an environment or a db

password---a string

cipher---one of :unknown, :aes or :rijndael

flags---an integer

boolean---a boolean

Description:

Enable encryption on an environment or database. :AES and :Rijndael are the same thing. If cipher is :unknown, the cipher will be detected automatically (the database must already exist). Returns NIL if encryption is not supported. Note that DB-SET-ENCRYPTION only sets the password; databases are not encrypted until the DB_ENCRYPT flag is set.

See Also:

WITH-ENVIRONMENT, WITH-DATABASE.
